metadata.title: United States Coin Taxonomy Database - Complete Edition
metadata.description: Comprehensive database of US coin series, mintages, varieties, and key dates
metadata.source: Compiled from PCGS CoinFacts, NGC, Red Book, US Mint records
metadata.note: This file combines all individual denomination files for convenience

coins.notes: Ultimate key date, extremely low mintage
Third lowest mintage, first San Francisco Indian cent
Lowest mintage of series, final year

varieties.name: Bronze
varieties.description: Error struck in bronze instead of steel

varieties.name: Steel
varieties.description: Error struck in steel instead of bronze

varieties.name: Birth and Early Childhood
varieties.description: 2009 Bicentennial - Birth and Early Childhood reverse

varieties.name: Birth and Early Childhood
varieties.description: 2009 Bicentennial - Birth and Early Childhood reverse

coins.notes: First P mintmark on cents since wartime
24 minted (all proofs), 9 known, values exceed $1.5 million
Final year micro S variety exists
Last silver dime, highest mintage dime ever
Final year of silver Roosevelt dime
Second key date Carson City issue

varieties.name: 3-Legged Buffalo
varieties.description: Famous variety with missing front leg

varieties.name: Type I
varieties.description: Eagle wing coverage differs from Type II

coins.notes: First W mint quarters - various designs, 2 million each
W mint quarters continue - various designs, 2 million each

silver_40.name: 40% Silver
silver_40.notes: Half dollars and some Eisenhower dollars - transitional composition

silver_wartime.name: Wartime Silver
silver_wartime.notes: Jefferson nickels during WWII to conserve nickel for war effort

copper_nickel.name: Copper-Nickel
copper_nickel.notes: Standard composition for nickels and clad coin outer layers

copper_nickel_indian.name: Copper-Nickel (Indian Head)
copper_nickel_indian.notes: Early Indian Head cent composition before bronze adoption

zinc_copper_plated.name: Copper-Plated Zinc
zinc_copper_plated.notes: Modern penny composition - zinc core with copper plating

steel_zinc_coated.name: Steel with Zinc Coating
steel_zinc_coated.notes: Wartime steel cent composition to conserve copper

clad_cupronickel.name: Copper-Nickel Clad
clad_cupronickel.notes: Modern dimes, quarters, and some dollars composition

P.name: Philadelphia Mint
P.notes: Original US Mint facility. No mint mark used on most coins until 1979.

O.name: New Orleans Mint
O.notes: Closed 1861-1879 during Civil War and Reconstruction

CC.name: Carson City Mint
CC.notes: Specialized in silver coins from local mines

Poor.description: Barely identifiable, most details worn smooth

Fair.description: Some details visible but heavily worn

Good.description: Major design visible but faint, rims worn

Very Good.description: Design clear but flat, some detail visible

Fine.description: Moderate even wear, all major details visible

Very Fine.description: Light even wear on high points, sharp details

Extremely Fine.description: Slight wear on highest points only

About Uncirculated.description: Traces of wear on highest points

Uncirculated.description: No wear, but may have bag marks
